formatted_address: LG09, Lower Ground Floor, Persiaran Puteri Selatan, Puteri Harbour, 79000 Iskandar Puteri, Johor Darul Ta'zim, Malaysia
name: Kampung Carabao Puteri Harbour

reviews.text: If I can use one word to describe the food here, it is “soggy” and “flavourful”. All of the dishes were consistently soggy and overcooked. The flavours have been amped up to be as salty and sweet as one would have imagined. It is unbelievable how the restaurant could have garnered an average of 4.5stars here. However the consolation being the price is reasonable, would rather they optimize for quality and price it higher…

Great Thai food with authentic flavors! The dishes were fresh, well-seasoned, and absolutely delicious. Cozy atmosphere with a beautiful view of Puteri Harbour. Friendly service and reasonable prices. Highly recommended for Thai food lovers!

Our team had lunch at Kampung Carabao , which overlooks the yacht harbour and is located in the quiet surroundings of Forest City. The peaceful environment made for a relaxing dining experience. Aesthetically, the restaurant is pleasing, with a traditional Thai vibe.

As for the food, the Tom Yum soup was excellent, as were the pineapple fried rice, pandan chicken, and prawn omelette. However, the Pad Thai was too soggy, and the crispy kangkong was overly oily and lacked flavor.

Staff is friendly,
Only the food is a bit different taste from other Carabao at Stulang.
Price is reasonable .
Only the food quality and taste a bit  disappointed
I ordered Mango Sticky Rice but seems sticky rice was overcooked.
But depends on your preference.
It’s only my opinion.
Sawadee ka. Glorious Tom Yam with seafood swimming in the soup. Don’t forget  Good ambience except you would have make booking especially during Ramadhan. Else be prepare to wait at the long queue.

vicinity: LG09, Lower Ground Floor, Persiaran Puteri Selatan, Puteri Harbour, Iskandar Puteri
